gurmukhi: qws ikau n pCwnhI jo hoih hY Ab hY ] inhPl kwhy Bjq pwhn qoih kCu Pil dY ]
transliteration: Taas Kio Na Pachhaad-hijo Hoh(i) Hai Ab Hai|| Nihphal Kaahe Bhajat Paahan Toh(i) Kachh(u) Phal(i) Dai||
translation: Why do you not pray to Him, who will be there in future and who is there in the present? You are worshipping the stones uselessly; what will you gain by that worship?

gurmukhi: qws syvhu jws syviq hoih pUrx kwm ] hoih mnsw skl pUrx lYq jw ko nwm ]11]85]
transliteration: Taas Sevoh Jaas Sevat(i) Hoh(i) Paaran Kaam|| Hoh(i) Mansaa Sakal Pooran Lait Jaa Ko Naam||11||85||
translation: Only worship Him who will fulfil your wishes; mediate on that Name, which will fulfil your wishes.11.85.

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD kInI jbY bfweI ] rIJy dyv idAwl iqh aUpr pUrx purK sdweI ]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Keenijabai Badaaee|| Reejhe Dev Diaal Tih Oopar Pooran Purakh Sadaaee||
translation: When He was eulogized in this way, then the perfect Purusha, the Lord was pleased with the king Parasnath;

gurmukhi: Awpin imly dyv drSin BXo isMG krI AsvwrI ] lIny C`qR lMkrw kUdq nwcx gx dYqwrI ]12]86]
transliteration: Aapan(i) Mile Dev Darshan(i) Bhayo Singh Kariasvdaree|| Leene Chhattra Lankaraa Koodat Naachanndgad Daitdaree||12||86||
translation: In order to bestow His sight to him, He mounted on a lion; He had a canopy over His head and the ganas, demons etc. began to dance in front of Him.12.86.

gurmukhi: Jmkq AsqR Ctw S`sqRin kI bwjq faur Apwr ] inrqq BUq pRyq nwnwibD fhkq iPrq bYqwr ]
transliteration: Jhamkat Astra Chhataa Shasstan(i) Kibaajat Daur Apaar|| Nirtat Bhoot Prêt Naanaabidh Dahkat Phirat Baitaar||
translation: The arms and weapons glistened and the thunderous tabors were played; the ghosts, fiends and Vaitals danced and wandered;

gurmukhi: kuhkiq iPriq kwkxI kuhrq fhrq kTn mswn ] Ghriq ggin sGn irK dhlq ibfrq bXom ibvwn ]13]87]
transliteration: Kuhkat(i) Phirat(i) Kaakanikuharat Dahrat Kathan Masaan|| Ghahrat(i) Gadan(i) Saghan Rikh Dahlat Bidrat Byom Bivaan||13||87||
translation: The crows cawed and the ghosts etc. laughed; the sky thundered and the sages in fear wandered in their air-vehicles.13.87.

gurmukhi: kCu br mwghu pUq sXwny ] BUq Biv`K nhI qumrI sr swD crq hm jwny ]
transliteration: Kachh(u) Bar Maagoh Poot Sayaane|| Bhoot Bhavikkh Nahitoumrisar Saadh Charat Ham Jaane||
translation: “O son ! ask for a boon; no one has practised austerities like you in the past and there will also be none in the future;

gurmukhi: jo brdwn cho so mwNgo sB hm qumY idvwr ] kMcn rqn b`jR mukqwPl lIjih skl suDwr ]14]88]
transliteration: Jo Bardaan Chaho So Maano Sabh Ham Toumai Divaar|| Kanchanndrattan Bajjra Mouktaapal Leejah(i) Sakal Sudhaar||14||88||
translation: “You may ask for anything, I shall grant the same; I shall bestow on you the gold, Vajra, the fruit of salvation or anything else, I shall bestow the same on you.”14.88.
